member.summary: This element specifies whether multi level labels exists or not

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.PercentStacked
member.summary: Specifies that the chart series are drawn next to each other along the value axis and scaled to total 100%.

member.summary: Specifies that the chart series are drawn next to each other on the value axis.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.Standard
member.summary: Specifies that the chart series are drawn next to each other on the depth axis.

member.summary: This element specifies a series on a chart.

member.summary: This element specifies the order of the series in the collection. It is 0 based.

member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn as a cone, with the base of the cone on the floor and the point of the cone at the top of the data marker.

member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn with truncated cones such that the point of the cone would be the maximum data value.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.BarShapePyramid
member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn as a rectangular pyramid, with the base of the pyramid on the floor and the point of the pyramid at the top of the data marker.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.BarShapePyramidToMax
member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn with truncated cones such that the point of the cone would be the maximum data value.

member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn as a cylinder.

member.summary: Specifies the chart shall be drawn with a box shape.

member.summary: This element specifies the shape of a series or a 3-D bar chart.

member.summary: This element specifies the scale factor for the bubble chart. This element can be an integer value from 0 to 300, corresponding to a percentage of the default size.

member.summary: This element specifies the size of the marker in points.

member.summary: This element specifies the side wall.

member.summary: This element specifies a trend line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineNameTag
member.summary: This element specifies the name of the trend line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineTypeTag
member.summary: This element specifies the type of the trend line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineOrderTag
member.summary: This element specifies the order of the polynomial trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlinePeriodTag
member.summary: This element specifies the period of the trend line for a moving average trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineForwardTag
member.summary: This element specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On non-scatter charts, the value must be a multiple of 0.5.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineBackwardTag
member.summary: This element specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends before the data for the series that is being trended. On non-scatter charts, the value shall be 0 or 0.5.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.TrendlineIntercept
member.summary: This element specifies the value where the trend line shall cross the y axis. This property shall be supported only when the trend line type is exp, linear, or poly.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.DisplayRSquared
member.summary: This element specifies that the R-squared value of the trend line is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the equation).

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.DisplayEquation
member.summary: This element specifies that the equation for the trend line is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the R-squared value).

member.summary: This element specifies error bars.

member.summary: This element specifies the type of the error bars - positive, negative, or both.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarValueType
member.summary: This element specifies the type of values used to determine the length of the error bars.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarsNoCap
member.summary: This element specifies an end cap is not drawn on the error bars.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarValueTag
member.summary: This element specifies a value which is used with the Error Bar Type to determine the length of the error bars.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarPlusTag
member.summary: This element specifies the error bar value in the positive direction. It shall be used only when the errValType is cust.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarMinusTag
member.summary: This element specifies the error bar value in the negative direction. It shall be used only when the errValType is cust.

member.summary: Specifies that error bars shall be shown in the x direction.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarY
member.summary: Specifies that error bars shall be shown in the y direction.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Exporting.OOXML.ChartConstants.ErrorBarDirection
member.summary: This element specifies the direction of the error bars.

members.member: Digit shaping option: Replace European digits (U+0030...U+0039) by Arabic-Indic digits.
Digit shaping option: Replace Arabic-Indic digits by European digits (U+0030...U+0039).

Digit shaping option: Replace European digits (U+0030...U+0039) by Arabic-Indic digits if the most recent strongly directional character is an Arabic letter (its Bidi direction value is RIGHT_TO_LEFT_ARABIC). The initial state at the start of the text is assumed to be not an Arabic, letter, so European digits at the start of the text will not change. Compare to DIGITS_ALEN2AN_INIT_AL.

Digit shaping option: Replace European digits (U+0030...U+0039) by Arabic-Indic digits if the most recent strongly directional character is an Arabic letter (its Bidi direction value is RIGHT_TO_LEFT_ARABIC). The initial state at the start of the text is assumed to be an Arabic, letter, so European digits at the start of the text will change. Compare to DIGITS_ALEN2AN_INT_LR.
Bit mask for digit shaping options.
Digit type option: Use Arabic-Indic digits (U+0660...U+0669).
Digit type option: Use Eastern (Extended) Arabic-Indic digits (U+06f0...U+06f9).
Bit mask for digit type options.

Does all the line bidirectional processing with PdfChunk assembly.
@author Paulo Soares
The algorithm. Does not include line-based processing (Rules L1, L2). These are applied later in the line-based phase of the algorithm.
1) determining the paragraph level. Rules P2, P3. At the end of this function, the member variable paragraphEmbeddingLevel is set to either 0 or 1.

Process embedding format codes. Calls processEmbeddings to generate an embedding array from the explicit format codes. The embedding overrides in the array are then applied to the result types, and the result levels are initialized. @see #processEmbeddings

Rules X9. Remove explicit codes so that they may be ignored during the remainder of the main portion of the algorithm. The length of the resulting text is returned. @return the length of the data excluding explicit codes and BN.

Reinsert levels information for explicit codes. This is for ease of relating the level information to the original input data. Note that the levels assigned to these codes are arbitrary, they're chosen so as to avoid breaking level runs. @param textLength the length of the data after compression @return the length of the data (original length of types array supplied to constructor)

2) determining explicit levels Rules X1 - X8
The interaction of these rules makes handling them a bit complex. This examines resultTypes but does not modify it. It returns embedding and override information in the result array. The low 7 bits are the level, the high bit is set if the level is an override, and clear if it is an embedding.

3) resolving weak types Rules W1-W7.
Note that some weak types (EN, AN) remain after this processing is complete.
7) resolving implicit embedding levels Rules I1, I2.
Return multiline reordering array for a given level array. Reordering does not occur across a line break.
Return reordering array for a given level array. This reorders a single line. The reordering is a visual to logical map. For example, the leftmost char is string.CharAt(order[0]). Rule L2.
Return the base level of the paragraph.
Return true if the type is considered a whitespace type for the line break rules.
Return the strong type (L or R) corresponding to the level.
Return the limit of the run starting at index that includes only resultTypes in validSet. This checks the value at index, and will return index if that value is not in validSet.
Return the start of the run including index that includes only resultTypes in validSet. This assumes the value at index is valid, and does not check it.
Set resultTypes from start up to (but not including) limit to newType.
Set resultLevels from start up to (but not including) limit to newLevel.
Throw exception if type array is invalid.
Throw exception if paragraph embedding level is invalid. Special allowance for -1 so that default processing can still be performed when using this API.
Throw exception if line breaks array is invalid.

members.member: * Returns the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution. * The distribution has a mean of zero and a standard deviation of one. * * @param probability a probability corresponding to the normal distribution. * @return the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution.
You must ensure fA>0.0 and fX>0.0 valid results only if fX less than or equal to fA+1.0 uses power series
You must ensure fA>0.0 and fX>0.0)
You must ensure fA>0.0 and fX>0.0)
求单调函数方程一个实根的Fisher Wang迭代法

* 求非线性方程实根, 先使用二分法获得 根的大概范围 误差在1之内， 而后使用割线法获得最后的根。 * * 调用时，须覆盖计算方程左端函数f(x)值的虚函数 * double Func(double x) * * @param nNumRoots - 在[xStart, xEnd]内实根个数的预估值 * @param x - 一维数组，长度为m。返回在区间[xStart, xEnd]内搜索到的实根， * 实根个数由函数值返回 * @param xStart - 求根区间的左端点 * @param xEnd - 求根区间的右端点 * @param dblStep - 搜索求根时采用的步长 * @param eps - 精度控制参数 * @return int 型，求得的实根的数目

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.BlipFillTagName
member.summary: This element specifies the type of picture fill that the picture object will have. Because a picture has a picture fill already by default, it is possible to have two fills specified for a picture object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.BlipTagName
member.summary: This element specifies the existence of an image (binary large image or picture) and contains a reference to the image data.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AlphaModFixTag
member.summary: It's define the Picture fill option

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AlphaModFixattribute
member.summary: It's define the values of Transparency

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.EmbeddedPicture
member.summary: Specifies the identification information for an embedded picture. This attribute is used to specify an image that resides locally within the file.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LinkPicture
member.summary: Specifies the identification information for a linked picture. This attribute is used to specify an image that is added as external link.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PositionSizeAbsolute
member.summary: Specifies that the current start and end positions shall be maintained with respect to the distances from the absolute start point of the worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PositionRelative
member.summary: Specifies that the current drawing shall move with its row and column (i.e. the object is anchored to the actual from row and column), but that the size shall remain absolute.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PositionSizeRelative
member.summary: Specifies that the current drawing shall move and resize to maintain its row and column anchors (i.e. the object is anchored to the actual from and to row and column).

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.StretchTagName
member.summary: This element specifies that a BLIP should be stretched to fill the target rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TileTagName
member.summary: This element specifies that a BLIP should be tiled to fill the available space.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SourceRectangleTagName
member.summary: This element specifies the portion of the blip used for the fill.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FillRectTagName
member.summary: This element specifies a fill rectangle. When stretching of an image is specified, a source rectangle, srcRect, is scaled to fit the specified fill rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PictureTagName
member.summary: This element specifies the existence of a picture object within the document.

member.summary: It's define the Pictureformatvalue

member.summary: Specifies a coordinate on the x-axis.

member.summary: Specifies the ShapePropertiesExtensionList.

member.summry: This elemet specifies that the chart has inverted shape elements and that is to be filled with a solid color.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PresetShapeAttribute
member.summary: This element specifies when a preset geometric shape should be used instead of a custom geometric shape.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.DrawingTagName
member.summary: This element indicates that the sheet contains drawing components built on the drawingML platform.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.WorksheetDrawings
member.summary: This element specifies all drawing objects within the worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AdjustValuesList
member.summary: This element specifies the adjust values that will be applied to the specified shape.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ClientDataTagName
member.summary: This element is used to set certain properties related to a drawing element on the client spreadsheet application.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GraphicFrame
member.summary: This element describes a single graphical object frame for a spreadsheet which contains a graphical object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Shape
member.summary: This element specifies the existence of a single shape. A shape can either be a preset or a custom geometry, defined using the SpreadsheetDrawingML framework. In addition to a geometry each shape can have both visual and non-visual properties attached. Text and corresponding styling information can also be attached to a shape. This shape is specified along with all other shapes within either the shape tree or group shape elements.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ConnectionShape
member.summary: This element specifies the properties for a connection shape drawing element. A connection shape is a line, etc. that connects two other shapes in this drawing.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GroupShape
member.summary: This element specifies a group shape that represents many shapes grouped together. This shape is to be treated just as if it were a regular shape but instead of being described by a single geometry it is made up of all the shape geometries encompassed within it. Within a group shape each of the shapes that make up the group are specified just as they normally would. The idea behind grouping elements however is that a single transform can apply to many shapes at the same time.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.MacroAttribute
member.summary: This element specifies the custom function associated with the object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GraphicTag
member.summary: This element specifies the existence of a single graphic object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GraphicDataTag
member.summary: This element specifies the reference to a graphic object within the document.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.UriAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the URI, or uniform resource identifier that represents the data stored under this tag. The URI is used to identify the correct 'server' that can process the contents of this tag.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.NonVisualGraphicFramePr
member.summary: This element specifies all non-visual properties for a graphic frame.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextBodyPropertiesTag
member.summary: This element defines the body properties for the text body within a shape.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ListStylesTag
member.summary: This element specifies the list of styles associated with this body of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Paragraphs
member.summary: This element specifies the presence of a paragraph of text within the containing text body.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ParagraphProperties
member.summary: This element contains all paragraph level text properties for the containing paragraph. These paragraph properties should override any and all conflicting properties that are associated with the paragraph in question.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.DefaultParagraphProperites
member.summary: This element contains all default run level text properties for the text runs within a containing paragraph. These properties are to be used when overriding properties have not been defined within the rPr element.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ParagraphRun
member.summary: This element specifies the presence of a run of text within the containing text body.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ParagraphText
member.summary: This element specifies the actual text for this text run. This is the text that will be formatted using all specified body, paragraph and run properties. This element must be present within a run of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextRunProperites
member.summary: This element contains all run level text properties for the text runs within a containing paragraph.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FontBoldAttribute
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text will be formatted as bold text. If this attribute is omitted, than a value of 0, or false is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FontItalicAttribute
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text will be formatted as italic text. If this attribute is omitted, than a value of 0, or false is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FontStrikeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text will be formatted as strikethrough text. If this attribute is omitted, than no strikethrough is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FontSizeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the size of text within a text run. Whole points are specified in increments of 100 starting with 100 being a point size of 1. For instance a font point size of 12 would be 1200 and a font point size of 12.5 would be 1250. If this attribute is omitted, than the value in defRPr should be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FontUnderlineAttribute
member.summary: Specifies whether a run of text will be formatted as underlined text. If this attribute is omitted, than no underline is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AbsoluteAnchorTag
member.summary: This element is used as an anchor placeholder for a shape or group of shapes. It will anchor the object in the same position relative to sheet position and its extents are in EMU unit.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PositionTag
member.summary: This element describes the position of a drawing element within a spreadsheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.NoShapeGrouping
member.summary: Specifies that the generating application should not allow shape grouping for the corresponding connection shape.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GraphicFrameLocksTag
member.summary: This element specifies all locking properties for a graphic frame.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.CNVGraphicFramePr
member.summary: This element specifies the non-visual drawing properties for a graphic frame.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LineTag
member.summary: This element specifies an outline style that can be applied to a number of different objects such as shapes and text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LineWidthAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the width to be used for the underline stroke. If this attribute is omitted, then a value of 0 is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.CompoundLineTypeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the compound line type to be used for the underline stroke. If this attribute is omitted, then a value of sng is assumed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.NoFillTag
member.summary: This element specifies that no fill will be applied to the parent element.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SolidFillTag
member.summary: This element specifies a solid color fill. The shape is filled entirely with the specified color.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.MiterJoinTag
member.summary: border miter join Tag

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.BevelJoinTag
member.summary: border bevel join tag

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SRGBColorTag
member.summary: This element specifies a color using the red, green, blue RGB color model. Red, green, and blue is expressed as sequence of hex digits, RRGGBB. A perceptual gamma of 2.2 is used.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SchemeColorTag
member.summary: This element specifies a color bound to a user's theme. As with all elements which define a color, it is possible to apply a list of color transforms to the base color defined.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SystemColorTag
member.summary: This color is based upon the value that this color currently has within the system on which the document is being viewed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SystemColorHexAttribute
member.summary: Applications shall use the lastClr attribute to determine the absolute value of the last color used if system colors are not supported.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PresetDashTag
member.summary: This element specifies that a preset line dashing scheme should be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.BackgroundColorTag
member.summary: This element specifies the background color of a Pattern fill.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ForegroundColorTag
member.summary: This element specifies the foreground color of a pattern fill.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PatternFillTag
member.summary: This element specifies a pattern fill. A repeated pattern is used to fill the object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.PresetPattern
member.summary: Specifies one of a set of preset patterns to fill the object.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.RoundTag
member.summary: This element specifies that lines joined together will have a round join.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientFillTag
member.summary: This element defines a gradient fill.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GroupFillTag
member.summary: This element specifies decorations which can be added to the head of a line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.HeadEnd
member.summary: This element specifies GroupFillTag.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TailEnd
member.summary: This element specifies decorations which can be added to the tail of a line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientStopsTag
member.summary: The list of gradient stops that specifies the gradient colors and their relative positions in the color band.

member.summary: This element specifies a linear gradient.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientTailTag
member.summary: It's define the Tailtag property

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientAngleAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the direction of color change for the gradient. To define this angle, let its value be x measured clockwise. Then ( -sin x, cos x ) is a vector parallel to the line of constant color in the gradient fill.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientScaledAttribute
member.summary: Whether the gradient angle scales with the fill region.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientPathTag
member.summary: This element defines that a gradient fill will follow a path vs. a linear line.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientPathAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the path to follow.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientStopTag
member.summary: This element defines a gradient stop. A gradient stop consists of a position where the stop appears in the color band.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GradientPositionAttribute
member.summary: Specifies where this gradient stop should appear in the color band.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AlphaTag
member.summary: This element specifies its input color with the specific opacity, but with its color unchanged.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.FillToRectTag
member.summary: This element defines the "focus" rectangle for the center shade, specified relative to the fill tile rectangle. The center shade fills the entire tile except the margins specified by each attribute.

member.summary: This element specifies a Color Change Effect. Instances of clrFrom are replaced with instances of clrTo

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.UseAlphaTag
member.summary: This element indicates whether the input color use the specific opacity

member.summary: This element specifies a Color From.

member.summary: Specifies the left edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TopAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the top edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.RightAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the right edge of the rectangle.

member.summary: Specifies the bottom edge of the rectangle.

member.summary: Specifies the left edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.CropTop
member.summary: Specifies the top edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.CropRight
member.summary: Specifies the right edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.CropBottom
member.summary: Specifies the bottom edge of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TintTag
member.summary: This element specifies a lighter version of its input color. A 10% tint is 10% of the input color combined with 90% white.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ShadeTag
member.summary: This element specifies a darker version of its input color. A 10% shade is 10% of the input color combined with 90% black.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.GammaTag
member.summary: This element specifies that the output color rendered by the generating application should be the sRGB gamma shift of the input color.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.InverseGammaTag
member.summary: This element specifies that the output color rendered by the generating application should be the inverse sRGB gamma shift of the input color.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LuminanceModulation
member.summary: This element specifies the input color with its luminance modulated by the given percentage.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.HueModulation
member.summary: /// This element specifies the input color with its hue modulated by the given percentage.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Luminance
member.summary: This element specifies the input color with its luminance.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SaturationModulation
member.summary: This element specifies the input color with its saturation modulated by the given percentage.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Saturation
member.summary: This element specifies the input color with its saturation.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SaturationOffset
member.summary: This element specifies the input color with its saturation offset.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Shade
member.summary: This element specifies shade.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextRotationAttribute
member.summary: This element specified the rotation of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.Baseline
member.summary: Specifies that all text in the parent object shall be aligned to the baseline of each character when displayed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LatinTag
member.summary: This element specifies that a Latin font be used for a specific run of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TypefaceTag
member.summary: Represents font type face.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ControlsTag
member.summary: Represents embedded controls in worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.ControlTag
member.summary: Represents a single embedded control.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.NonVisualDrawingProperties
member.summary: This element specifies the non-visual drawing properties for a shape. These properties are to be used by the generating application to determine how the shape should be dealt with.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextBoxAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding shape is a text box and thus should be treated as such by the generating application. If this attribute is omitted then it is assumed that the corresponding shape is not specifically a text box.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.NonVisualShapeProperties
member.summary: This element specifies all non-visual properties for a shape. This element is a container for the non-visual identification properties, shape properties and application properties that are to be associated with a shape. This allows for additional information that does not affect the appearance of the shape to be stored.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextBody
member.summary: This element specifies the existence of text to be contained within the corresponding shape. All visible text and visible text related properties are contained within this element. There can be multiple paragraphs and within paragraphs multiple runs of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SubscriptBaseline
member.summary: Default value for subscript baseline value.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.SuperscriptBaseline
member.summary: Default value for superscript baseline value.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AnchorAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the anchoring position of the txBody within the shape. If this attribute is omitted, then a value of t, or top is implied.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.AnchorCenterAttribute
member.summary: Specifies if the anchoring position of the txBody is centered within the shape.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.TextBoxRotationAttribute
member.summary: Determines if the text within the given text body should be displayed vertically. If this attribute is omitted, then a value of horz, or no vertical text is implied.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.Spreadsheet.Shapes.Drawings.LockTextAttribute

Sets parameter nodes for this function.
@param arrParams parameters. Every element is a parameter of this function.

Reads the String value from current token. If String value is in token's data, after read the pointer will be moved to the next token. If String value is in token's additional data, after read the additional data pointer will be moved to the next sub-token. @return String if current token is for String. Returns null if current token is not for String.

Gets the position of current token in the formula.
@return the position of current token in the formula.

Gets the position of current additional data in the formula.
@return the position of current additional data in the formula.

Checks whether there is a token can be processed.
@return false if this iterator has reached the end of formula.
Moves cursor from current token to the next token in formula. @return whether current token can be recognized.

Checks whether current token is CellAddress, inclues RefErr.
@return true if current token is CellAddress.

Checks whether current token is CellRange, includes AreaErr.
@return true if current token is CellRange.

Checks whether current token is Name, inclues NameX.
@return true if current token is Name.

py add

members.member: Processes one chunk in png file. Default behavior is move to next chunk directly. When calling this method, the pointer in png stream is just at the begin of data block of current chunk. After this call, the pointer in png stream must be at the end of this chunk(after the crc block). @return whether continue to process following chunks. If false be returned, visitor will stop to read and process following chunks.

Gets the start position of current chunk in the png data.
@return the start position of current chunk in the png data(data size, chunk code, chunk data, crc).

Gets current chunk code.
@return current chunk code.

Gets current chunk's data size.
@return current chunk's data size(crc is not included).

member.name: T:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from right to left horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRightRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then left to right horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from bottom to top vertically, then from left to right horizontally on the page.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottomRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that any East Asian text shall be rotated 270 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Core.Converter.General.Word.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeftRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then right to left horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: T:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType
member.summary: Represents sheet protection flags enums.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.None
member.summary: Not allows the user to do any thing on a protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.Objects
member.summary: True to protect shapes.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.Scenarios
member.summary: True to protect scenarios.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.FormattingCells
member.summary: True allows the user to format any cell on a protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.FormattingColumns
member.summary: True allows the user to format any column on a protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.FormattingRows
member.summary: True allows the user to format any row on a protected.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.InsertingColumns
member.summary: True allows the user to insert columns on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.InsertingRows
member.summary: True allows the user to insert rows on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.InsertingHyperlinks
member.summary: True allows the user to insert hyperlinks on the worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.DeletingColumns
member.summary: True allows the user to delete columns on the protected worksheet, where every cell in the column to be deleted is unlocked.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.DeletingRows
member.summary: True allows the user to delete rows on the protected worksheet, where every cell in the row to be deleted is unlocked.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.LockedCells
member.summary: True allows the user to select locked cells on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.Sorting
member.summary: True allows the user to sort on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.Filtering
member.summary: True allows the user to set filters on the protected worksheet. Users can change filter criteria but can not enable or disable an auto filter.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.UsingPivotTables
member.summary: True allows the user to use pivot table reports on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.UnLockedCells
member.summary: True allows the user to select locked cells on the protected worksheet.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.Content
member.summary: Represents all flags

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.SheetProtectionType.All
member.summary: Allows the user to do any thing on a protected worksheet.

member.name: T:Spire.Xls.FontVertialAlignmentType
member.summary: Defines the possible settings for vertical alignment of a run of text. This is used to get superscript or subscript text without altering the font size properties of the rest of the text run.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.FontVertialAlignmentType.Baseline
member.summary: Returns the text in this run to the baseline, default, alignment, and returns it to the original font size.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.FontVertialAlignmentType.Superscript
member.summary: Specifies that this text should be superscript. Raises the text in this run above the baseline and changes it to a smaller size, if a smaller size is available.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.FontVertialAlignmentType.Subscript
member.summary: Specifies that this text should be subscript. Lowers the text in this run below the baseline and changes it to a smaller size, if a smaller size is available.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.TextboxTxid
member.summary:
int. id for the textbox.
Although this attribute will be present in the model during write to DOC, it does not have any meaning for the model.
This is an index into plcfTxbxs, but need to deduct one and shift right by 16 bits. int txid = (int)((txbxIdx + 1) shl 16);
The lower 16 bits indicate the index of the linked checkbox.
This attribute is only used during reading and writing into binary DOC. There is a two-way link between shape and txbx in a DOC file and during read.
Also see OleTxid. OleTxid is written instead of TextboxTxid for OLE objects.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.GeometryXLimo
member.summary:
int. A signed integer x coordinate in geometry space that specifies a value above which limousine scaling is used. The spec says default is 0x8000000, but we default to 0 at the moment!
Limo stretches are points on a shape's edge that define where and how a shape may be stretched by a user in a graphical editor.
2.3.6.22 xLimo in the DOC SPEC

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.EquationXML
member.summary: Untested. String. This property is present if the shape represents an equation generated by Office 2007 or later. The property is a string of XML representing a Word 2003 XML document. The original equation is stored within the “oMathPara” tag within the document. Refer to the Office Open XML documentation for details on this XML representation of equations. If the document containing the shape is opened in Office 2007 or later, the shape is replaced with the equation in this document. Ver: 2007

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.ShapeName
member.summary:
Shape Name (present only if explicitly set).
RK One scenario where this is used is to create relationships between diagram nodes. Instead of basing relationships on shape ids, the relationships are created based on shape names (in DOC, RTF and model based on hashes of shape names). Shape id might change (at least can change in Spire.Doc when document is saved), shape name, on the other hand remains the same and makes the life easier (no need to update diagram relations). Shape name is usually generated by MS Word based on the shape id.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary:
When this attribute is specified, the shape is positioned using alignment relative to some object. The relative anchor is specified using the relative horizontal position value, all values are valid.
When the alignment value is Inside our Outside (in MS Word this is in the Book Layout dropdown), then MS Word allows the relative anchor to be only Margin or Page.
Occurs in EsShapeOptionsEx record. Note the values in the SPEC are wrong (off by 1).

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.BorderTopColor
member.summary:
These are 32bit color for the inline picture borders. Occur in EsShapeOptionsEx record. We read this attribute into the model initially, so it could occur in the model.
If the shape is an inline picture, then when the PICF structure is loaded, the 32bit colors specified by these attributes are applied to the borders. The border attributes BorderXXX are added to the model and these attributes are removed.

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.MetroBlob
member.summary: Untested. Seen complex value in defect 3397. The shape’s 2007 representation in Office Open XML format. The actual data is a package in Office XML format, which can simply be opened as a zip file. This zip file contains an XML file with the root element “sp”. Refer to the publically available Office Open XML documentation for more information about this data. In case we lose any property when converting a 2007 Office Art shape to 2003 shape, we use this blob to retrieve the original Office Art property data when opening the file in 2007. See Appendix F for more information. Ver: 2007

member.name: F:Spire.Xls.Converters.DrawingML.ShapeAttr.Dhgt
